plugin._field_explanation: If needed, specify the parent animation graph and any inheritance settings desired. Any animations from the parent graph which are not already present here will be available at runtime, even though you will not see them populated in this animation graph.
Keyframe events are stored and edited in an external tag file to support multiple authors. The contents of that tag file will be loaded into this animation graph at runtime.

_field_block_64.name: sound references|ABCDCC!*#Legacy field - please edit in new frame event tag below

_field_string_id.name: name^#Give this group of references a name.

_field_tag_reference_64.name: model#optional. only allow this event when used on this model

_field_string_id.name: model variant#optional. only allow this event when used on this model variant

_field_tag_reference_64.name: weapon#optional. only allow this event when this weapon is in use

_field_string_id.name: weapon variant#optional. only allow this event when this weapon variant is in use

_field_block_64.name: dialogue references|ABCDCC!*#Legacy field - please edit in new frame event tag below
effect references|ABCDCC!*#Legacy field - please edit in new frame event tag below

_field_string_id.name: name^#Give this group of references a name

_field_tag_reference_64.name: model#optional. only allow this event when used on this model

_field_string_id.name: model variant#optional. only allow this event when used on this model variant

_field_tag_reference_64.name: weapon#optional. only allow this event when this weapon is in use

_field_string_id.name: weapon variant#optional. only allow this event when this weapon variant is in use

plugin._field_explanation: PCA Blend Shape Animation data is stored in an external file due to it's size. If you do not specify a file here, one will be created for you if blend shape animation is imported.

item.Name: use dual mixing boards{costly! Don't use it unless you need it!!!!}
possesses default ik chains for a biped

plugin._field_explanation: Warning: Changing this compression setting will force that setting on animations in the graph. This is suitable for pre-testing different compression levels, but should not be used long term.

item.Name: invert#the mask includes everything except the nodes set below

plugin._field_explanation: IK Junctions are rigid parts of the IK solver. Hips and Shoulder areas, for exampleThese are optional, but required when full-body IK influence is desired
IK chains define full limbs like arms and legs. These are controlled byanimation events to lock the limb endpoints to key locations. They are also used to connect junctions

_field_block_64.name: ik chains|CCBBAA

_field_short_integer.name: rank!#calculated during post process where rank is default ordinal for solving
antecedents!#calculated during post process where bit index represents chain index

_field_block_64.name: special joints#add any joints you want skipped, or mark second hinges in limbs for z-legs

item.Name: static#this joint will be unchanged by IK
hinge#special marking of extra hinges for limbs only. Max 2

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Controls how much the chain can push or pull it's parent junction

_field_real_fraction.name: native pull strength#how much this chain wants to pull it's junction, even when not fully extended
native push strength#how much this chain wants to push it's junction, even when not fully extended
over extent pull strength#how much this chain wants to pull it's junction when beyond full extension
under extent push strength#how much this chain wants to push it's junction when below min extension

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Limits the effector node to a cone centered on the starting node

_field_real_fraction.name: effector cone limit power#how strongly we enforce that the end effector is in the cone defined below, when compared to the bind pose

_field_angle_bounds.name: pitch bounds:degrees#pitch angles of the limiting cone. 0= bind pose angle
yaw bounds:degrees#yaw angles of the limiting cone. 0= bind pose angle

_field_real_bounds.name: offset bounds#distance bounds of the limiting cone. 0= bind pose distance

item.Name: static#this joint will be unchanged by IK
hinge#special marking of extra hinges for limbs only. Max 2

_field_real_fraction.name: spline reversal strength#how much this chain well bend backwards, when required

plugin._field_explanation: Define a set of IK connection points, and combine them into sets. You can then references these ik sets in the Mode & State tree below.

_field_string_id.name: source marker#the marker name on this object where the point of attachment is
destination marker#the marker name of the attachment destination point

_field_long_block_index.name: chain to use#will be auto-set to the nearest chain if you don't name one

_field_string_id.name: weight source object function#allows a function to turn this IK point on or off
priority source object function#allows a function to adjust the priority of this chain in the full body solve

item.Name: Disable Quadruped Footlocking#stop the front feet (if any) from performing footlocking
Enable Biped Handlocking#Enable groundfitting of hands

_field_char_enum.name: desired compression#To change compression, set this value and re-import the sidecar to make it current.
current compression*#the current compression method used.

_field_real.name: weight#When variants are available, the weight values determine how often each is used. All weights are normalized, so the values can be anything you like.

_field_short_integer.name: loop frame index#For looping animations, the frame index to return to after completing the first loop.

item.Name: disable interpolation in#when set, no other animation may interpolate into this one. It will just pop to this animation instead.
disable interpolation out#when set, this animation may not interpolate into any other. It will just pop to the new animation.
disable mode ik#(Bipeds Only) disable any mode ik (found in the mode and state tree) for the entire animation. Typically, this is IK to tie hands/feet to vehicle locations.
disable weapon ik#(Bipeds Only) disable any weapon ik (found in the mode and state tree) for the entire animation. Typically, this is IK to tie secondary hands to weapon locations.
disable weapon aim/1st person#(Bipeds,Vehicles Only) disable aim screens while this animation is playing.
disable look screen#(Bipeds,Vehicles Only) disable look screens while this animation is playing.
disable transition adjustment# DEPRECATED, will be ignored
force weapon ik on#(Bipeds,Vehicles Only) force any weapon ik to be on while this animation is playing.
use custom blend-in time#when possible, interpolate into this animation using the 'blend in' time value below
enable animated source interpolation#Cross-fade animations instead of interpolating. Requires Dual Mixing Board setting in graph flags.
disable ik sets#(Bipeds Only) disable all IK sets while this animation is playing.
disable ik chains#(Bipeds Only) disable all IK chains while this animation is playing.
translate and scale root only#ignore all translation and scale on all nodes except the root
enable blend-out on replacement anims#(Replacement Anims Only) fade this replacement animation out as playback nears the end. Fades over 8 frames.
use custom blend-out time#(Replacement Anims Only) when possible, fade this animation out over the 'blend out' time below instead of the default 8 frames. Requires enable blend-out flag above.
override player input#(Player Only) use the movement data in this animation instead of player physics. Use only when animation must control the player verbatim.

_field_real.name: override blend in time!{override blend time}#The desired interpolation frame count into this anim. If 0, the default value 8 will be used. To disable interpolation, see the flags above.
override blend out time!#The desired interpolation frame count out of this anim. If 0, the default value 8 will be used. To disable interpolation, see the flags above.

item.Name: do not inherit for player graphs

_field_string_id.name: pca group name#Name of the PCA compression group to add this animation's blend shapes to. Must match one of the PCA Groups defined.

plugin._field_explanation: For each PCA Group desired, provide a unique name and desired number of blend shapes. Then, assign animations to these groups by setting their pca group name field. This is how blend shapes animations are grouped for compression.

_field_block_64.name: PCA Groups
_field_block_64._field_explanation: The PCA compression algorithm treats position, normal, and tension data as equally important when calculating error. Use the values below to prioritize various componenents so they are "more important" when determining error, and therefore are higher proirity for the algorithm to make accurate.

_field_real_fraction.name: interpolation rate:[0,1]#A value of zero or one means no interpolation.

_field_string_id.name: yaw source object function#if used, make sure you set the yaw source to 'object function'
pitch source object function#if used, make sure you set the pitch source to 'object function'

_field_short_enum.name: weight source#the primary weight control source

item.Name: damage left shoulder{damage focus left shoulder}
damage left arm{damage focus left arm}
damage left leg{damage focus left leg}
damage left foot{damage focus left foot}
damage right shoulder{damage focus right shoulder}
damage right arm{damage focus right arm}
damage right leg{damage focus right leg}
damage right foot{damage focus right foot}

_field_short_enum.name: secondary weight source#the optional secondary weight control source. Modulated with the primary if used.

item.Name: damage left shoulder{damage focus left shoulder}
damage left arm{damage focus left arm}
damage left leg{damage focus left leg}
damage left foot{damage focus left foot}
damage right shoulder{damage focus right shoulder}
damage right arm{damage focus right arm}
damage right leg{damage focus right leg}
damage right foot{damage focus right foot}

_field_string_id.name: weight source object function#if used, make sure you set the weight source to 'object function'
secondary weight object function#if used, make sure you set the secondary weight source to 'object function'

_field_short_block_index.name: weight function#Function applied to input from weight function source

item.Name: strict looping#loop without blending the first and last frames
hold last frame#pause on the last frame and hold

_field_string_id.name: unlock function#function output must match unlock value for this overlay to play

_field_real_bounds.name: unlock range#Unlocks this overlay when the unlock function values falls in this range. Unused when function isn't specified

_field_short_integer.name: start LOD taper#Percent of screen size at which we start to taper off application of the function overlay
end LOD taper#Percent of screen size at which we disable application of the function overlay

_field_long_block_index.name: bone mask#bones this interpolator applies to

_field_real.name: seconds#total interpolation time in seconds. recommended value= 0.25

_field_struct.name: default curve#for all bones not included in specific interpolators above

_field_string_id.name: state name^#name of the state this transition starts in
mode name#name of the mode this transition ends in
state name#name of the state this transition ends in

_field_long_block_index.name: transition lerp:NONE=engine default#interpolation to use when no animation is present. NONE=engine default

_field_struct.name: transition anim#When set, takes priority over a transition lerp

_field_string_id.name: anim timing function#when set, this function will control the transition animation playback from 0-1

_field_long_block_index.name: anim lerp in:NONE=engine default#interpolation to use when starting the transition anim. NONE=engine default
anim lerp out:NONE=engine default#interpolation to use when exiting the transition anim. NONE=engine default

_field_string_id.name: marker#the marker name on the object being attached
attach to marker#the marker name object (weapon, vehicle, etc.) the above marker is being attached to
weight source object function#allows a function to turn this IK point on or off
priority source object function#allows a function to adjust the priority of this chain in the full body solve

_field_real.name: animation parameter#Numerical value associated with the ranged action animation (e.g. velocity for jumps)

item.Name: destroy defenses# cavalier shard rip, etc.

_field_string_id.name: marker#the marker name on the object being attached
attach to marker#the marker name object (weapon, vehicle, etc.) the above marker is being attached to
weight source object function#allows a function to turn this IK point on or off
priority source object function#allows a function to adjust the priority of this chain in the full body solve

_field_block_64.name: vehicle suspension

_field_string_id.name: marker name#this marker should be parented to the vehicle root node
contact marker name#this marker should be parented to the wheel node

_field_real.name: mass point offset#distance along the vehicle's up direction to move the wheel from the marker location

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Only Necessary for suspensions with a destroyed state

_field_long_integer.name: alias index*#runtime use. marks this entry as an alias of another entry in the block

plugin._field_explanation: fields used by varous compression codecs to store shared or global data for this graph. Do not manually edit.
